titles.en: Chapter 32 – The perfume and the aroma for the Fasting one
Chapter 32 – The perfume and the aroma for the Fasting one

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ غِيَاثِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ عَلِيّاً صَلَوَاتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ كَرِهَ الْمِسْكَ أَنْ يَتَطَيَّبَ بِهِ الصَّائِمُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Giyas Bin Ibrahim, 
(It has been narrated) from Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, from his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> that Ali<sup>asws</sup> disliked that the Musk be applied with by the Fasting one’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ الْحَذَّاءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْفَيْضِ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَنْهَى عَنِ النَّرْجِسِ فَقُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ لِمَ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ لِأَنَّهُ رَيْحَانُ الْأَعَاجِمِ وَ أَخْبَرَنِي بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِنَا أَنَّ الْأَعَاجِمَ كَانَتْ تَشَمُّهُ إِذَا صَامُوا وَ قَالُوا إِنَّهُ يُمْسِكُ الْجُوعَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Dawood Bin Is’haq Al Haza’a, from Muhammad Bin Al Fayz who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> forbid from the daffodils. So I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! Why is that so?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Because it is an aroma of the non-Arabs’. And, one of our companions informed me that the non-Arabs used to smell it when they were Fasting, and said, ‘It restrains the hunger’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْفَضْلِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ قَالَ كَانَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا صَامَ تَطَيَّبَ بِالطِّيبِ وَ يَقُولُ الطِّيبُ تُحْفَةُ الصَّائِمِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from his father, from Abdullah Bin Al Fazl Al Nowfaly, from Al Hassan Bin Rashid who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, whenever he<sup>asws</sup> Fasted, applied the perfume, and he<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘The perfume is a gift of the Fasting one’.

verses.text:
مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْعَلَاءِ بْنِ رَزِينٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الصَّائِمُ يَشَمُّ الرَّيْحَانَ وَ الطِّيبَ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ .
وَ رُوِيَ أَنَّهُ لَا يَشَمُّ الرَّيْحَانَ لِأَنَّهُ يُكْرَهُ لَهُ أَنْ يَتَلَذَّذَ بِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Al A’ala Bin Razeyn, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The Fasting one smells the aroma and the perfume. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem with it’.
And it is reported that he<sup>asws</sup> did not smell the aromas because it was disliked for him<sup>asws</sup> that he<sup>asws</sup> derive pleasure with it.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الْحَائِضُ تَقْضِي الصَّلَاةَ قَالَ لَا قُلْتُ تَقْضِي الصَّوْمَ قَالَ نَعَمْ قُلْتُ مِنْ أَيْنَ جَاءَ ذَا قَالَ إِنَّ أَوَّلَ مَنْ قَاسَ إِبْلِيسُ قُلْتُ وَ الصَّائِمُ يَسْتَنْقِعُ فِي الْمَاءِ قَالَ نَعَمْ قُلْتُ فَيَبُلُّ ثَوْباً عَلَى جَسَدِهِ قَالَ لَا قُلْتُ مِنْ أَيْنَ جَاءَ ذَا قَالَ مِنْ ذَاكَ قُلْتُ الصَّائِمُ يَشَمُّ الرَّيْحَانَ قَالَ لَا لِأَنَّهُ لَذَّةٌ وَ يُكْرَهُ لَهُ أَنْ يَتَلَذَّذَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Al Hassan Bin Rashid who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The menstruating woman has to make up the (missed) Prayer?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No’. I said, ‘She has to make up the Fast?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’. I said, ‘From where has that come about?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The first one who anlogised was Iblees<sup>la</sup>’. I said, ‘And the Fasting one can stay still in the water?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’. I said, ‘So, can he wear wet clothes upon his body?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No’. I said, ‘From where has that come about?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘From that’. I said, ‘The Fasting one can smell the aromas?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No, because he would derive pleasure, and he<sup>asws</sup> disliked it for himself<sup>asws</sup> that he derives pleasure’.
